Class Gek

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for object and common/base operations.

      static boolean equals(@Nullable java.lang.Object a, @Nullable java.lang.Object b)
      Returns result of equaling follows: returns Objects.equals for given objects if they are not arrays; if given objects are arrays of which types are same primitive type, returns Arrays.equals for them; if given objects are object array, returns Arrays.deepEquals for them; else returns Objects.equals for given objects
      static boolean equalsWith(@Nullable java.lang.Object a, @Nullable java.lang.Object b, boolean arrayCheck, boolean deepEquals)
      Returns result of equaling follows: if given objects are arrays of which types are same primitive type and array-check is true, returns Arrays.equals for them; if given objects are object array and both array-check and deep-equals are true, returns Arrays.deepEquals for them; if given objects are object array and array-check is true and deep-equals is false, returns Arrays.equals for them; else returns Objects.equals for given objects

      static int hashWith(@Nullable java.lang.Object obj, boolean arrayCheck, boolean deepHash)
      Returns hash code follows: if given object is primitive array and array-check is true, returns Arrays.hashCode for it; if given object is Object[] and both array-check and deep-to-string are true, returns Arrays.deepHashCode for it; if given object is Object[] and array-check is true and deep-to-string is false, returns Arrays.hashCode for it; else returns Objects.hashCode for given object

        public static <T> T notNull(@Nullable
                            T obj,
                            T defaultValue)
        Returns default value if given object is null, or given object itself if it is not null: 
             return obj == null ? defaultValue : obj;
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        defaultValue - default value
        Returns:

      • notNull

        public static <K,V> V notNull(@Nullable
                              K obj,
                              V defaultValue,
                              java.util.function.Function<? super K,? extends V> function)
        Returns default value if given object is null, or the value computed by given function if it is not null: 
             return obj == null ? defaultValue : function.apply(obj);
        Type Parameters:
        K - type of given object
        V - type of result
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        defaultValue - default value
        function - given function
        Returns:
        default value if given object is null, or the value computed by given function if it is not null

      • orNull

        @Nullable
public static <K,V> V orNull(@Nullable
                                        K obj,
                                        java.util.function.Function<? super K,? extends V> function)
        Returns the value computed by given function if it is not null, or null if it is null: 
             return obj == null ? null : function.apply(obj);
        Type Parameters:
        K - type of given object
        V - type of result
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        function - given function
        Returns:
        the value computed by given function if it is not null, or null if it is null

      • hash

        public static int hash(@Nullable
                       @Nullable java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns hash code follows:
        • returns Objects.hashCode for given object if it is not an array;
        • if given object is primitive array, returns Arrays.hashCode for it;
        • if given object is Object[], returns Arrays.deepHashCode for it;
        • else returns Objects.hashCode for given object

        This method is same as: hash(obj, true, true)

        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        Returns:
        the hash code

      • hash

        public static int hash(java.lang.Object... objs)
        Returns deep-hash-code for given objects.
        Parameters:
        objs - given objects
        Returns:
        the hash code

      • hashWith

        public static int hashWith(@Nullable
                           @Nullable java.lang.Object obj,
                           boolean arrayCheck,
                           boolean deepHash)
        Returns hash code follows:
        • if given object is primitive array and array-check is true, returns Arrays.hashCode for it;
        • if given object is Object[] and both array-check and deep-to-string are true, returns Arrays.deepHashCode for it;
        • if given object is Object[] and array-check is true and deep-to-string is false, returns Arrays.hashCode for it;
        • else returns Objects.hashCode for given object
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        arrayCheck - the array-check
        deepHash - whether deep-hash
        Returns:
        the hash code

      • systemHash

        public static int systemHash(@Nullable
                             @Nullable java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns identity hash code for given object, same as System.identityHashCode(Object).
        Parameters:
        obj - given object
        Returns:
        the system hash code

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(@Nullable
                             @Nullable java.lang.Object a,
                             @Nullable
                             @Nullable java.lang.Object b)
        Returns result of equaling follows:
        • returns Objects.equals for given objects if they are not arrays;
        • if given objects are arrays of which types are same primitive type, returns Arrays.equals for them;
        • if given objects are object array, returns Arrays.deepEquals for them;
        • else returns Objects.equals for given objects

        This method is same as: equals(a, b, true, true)

        Parameters:
        a - given object a
        b - given object b
        Returns:
        the result of equaling

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(java.lang.Object... objs)
        Returns deep-equals for given objects.
        Parameters:
        objs - given objects
        Returns:
        the result of equaling

      • equalsWith

        public static boolean equalsWith(@Nullable
                                 @Nullable java.lang.Object a,
                                 @Nullable
                                 @Nullable java.lang.Object b,
                                 boolean arrayCheck,
                                 boolean deepEquals)
        Returns result of equaling follows:
        • if given objects are arrays of which types are same primitive type and array-check is true, returns Arrays.equals for them;
        • if given objects are object array and both array-check and deep-equals are true, returns Arrays.deepEquals for them;
        • if given objects are object array and array-check is true and deep-equals is false, returns Arrays.equals for them;
        • else returns Objects.equals for given objects
        Parameters:
        a - given object a
        b - given object b
        arrayCheck - the array-check
        deepEquals - whether deep-equals
        Returns:
        the result of equaling

      • convertType

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable java.lang.Object convertType(@Nullable
                                                                @Nullable java.lang.Object source,
                                                                java.lang.reflect.Type sourceType,
                                                                java.lang.reflect.Type targetType)
        Converts source object from source type to target type. The result of this method in 3 types: null, GekWrapper and others:
        • null: means this converter can not do this conversion;
        • GekWrapper: wrapped object (from GekWrapper.get()) is actual result of conversion, including null and GekWrapper itself;
        • Others: any other type of returned object is the actual result of conversion.
        Using GekConverter.getResult(Object) can get actual result object from wrapper.
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        sourceType - source type
        targetType - target type
        Returns:
        converted object or null
        See Also:
        GekConverter.convertType(Object, Type, Type)

      • copyProperties

        public static <T> T copyProperties(java.lang.Object source,
                                   T dest,
                                   boolean copyNull)
        Copies properties from source object to dest object by GekBeanCopier. The properties with null value will not be copied if copyNull is true. Otherwise, the null will not be copied.
        Type Parameters:
        T - dest type
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        dest - dest object
        copyNull - whether copy null properties
        Returns:
        dest object
        See Also:
        GekBeanCopier

      • copyProperties

        public static <T> T copyProperties(java.lang.Object source,
                                   T dest,
                                   java.lang.String... ignoredProperties)
        Copies properties from source object to dest object by GekBeanCopier.defaultCopier(). The properties that are specified to ignore will not be copied.
        Type Parameters:
        T - dest type
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        dest - dest object
        ignoredProperties - property names that are specified to ignore
        Returns:
        dest object
        See Also:
        GekBeanCopier

      • copyProperties

        public static <T> T copyProperties(java.lang.Object source,
                                   T dest,
                                   boolean copyNull,
                                   java.lang.String... ignoredProperties)
        Copies properties from source object to dest object by GekBeanCopier.defaultCopier(). The properties with null value will not be copied if copyNull is true, and the properties that are specified to ignore will not be copied.
        Type Parameters:
        T - dest type
        Parameters:
        source - source object
        dest - dest object
        copyNull - whether copy null properties
        ignoredProperties - property names that are specified to ignore
        Returns:
        dest object
        See Also:
        GekBeanCopier

      • countBlock

        public static int countBlock(int totalSize,
                             int blockSize)
        Returns block count of total value and block size: 
             return totalSize % blockSize == 0 ? totalSize / blockSize : totalSize / blockSize + 1;
        Parameters:
        totalSize - total size
        blockSize - block size
        Returns:
        block count

      • countBlock

        public static long countBlock(long totalSize,
                              long blockSize)
        Returns block count of total value and block size: 
             return totalSize % blockSize == 0 ? totalSize / blockSize : totalSize / blockSize + 1;
        Parameters:
        totalSize - total size
        blockSize - block size
        Returns:
        block count
